item.title: How do you
item.dc:creator: @Stone_Sour Stone Sour
item.description:
@Stone_Sour wrote:

Just go to the place you want your npc to be and get the coords(f4)
Then go to AutoSpawn.cfg and post the coords and monster Id there.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you
item.dc:creator: @eambo eambo
item.description:
@eambo wrote:

If you open up the autospawn.cfg you can set the monsters to spawn there.

Go into you’re client and type in ::coordson. This will show you’re co-ordinates when you walk.

Now in autospawn.cfg, you will see:

spawn = z x y A x1 y1 x2 y2 B Varrock Gate Guard at Magic Shop

Z = The number of the npc. Find these by opening moparscape, and going to npcid list (KBD is 50 by the way)
X = It’s X Co-ordinate. The first number in you’re co-ords as you’re walking
Y = It’s Y Co-ordinate. The second number in you’re Co-ords as you’re walking
A = Height. Usually 0, if it’s on the second floor, it’s 1.
X1 = It’s first X range. This means how far it can walk
Y1 = It’s first Y range. This means how far it can walk
X2 = It’s second X range. This means how far it can walk
Y2 = It’s second Y range. This means how far it can walk
B = Walktype. I’ve never experimented with this, hehe.

Wondering why there’s 2 X and 2 Y’s for walking? Lemme explain:
Y2
|
|
|
X1------------------------------X2
|
|
|
Y1

It sets the limits to how far it can walk =-)

Hope this helps.

Read full topic
